Brendon Murphy writes here.

See also the archive & links.

My experience runs from unix & linux system administration, to programming for the web. I'm passionate about open source, and spend much of my time these days in Ruby.

My passions include git, github, rspec, rails, jQuery, programming in general, and my girlfriend Arielle.

I like to hang out with other Ruby-ists in Orange County. You can connect with us at the monthly OC Ruby Users Group. We'd love to see you there.

WorkingWithRails is the online home of the world's community of Ruby on Rails users. Go check my profile there.

Games I'd like to play

Here’s a list of the games I’d really like to play with some friends. They are mostly what I’d call Storytelling games. I take that definition as kind of a cross between role playing games and storytelling. Another description might be collaborative storytelling. If you played in our recent group Once Upon a Time game, you have a flavor for such a game, albeit lighter weight than the following.

  • Polaris: already own it
  • Dogs in the Vineyard: willing to buy it
  • My Life with Master: bought it
  • Universalis: in the mail

I also want to run a game of Pandemonium, which is more of a straight laced RPG, minus the magic and dwarves. Other more traditional RPGs I’m interested in are Call of Cthulhu (ooo…scary) and Northern Crown.

—Dec 29, 2005
